text:
Q: Angular Vitest multiple configurations to do remote debugging locally and run headless in pipeline A:

Vitest does not run tests in Chrome, so the old Karma customLauncher + --remote-debugging-port=9333 pattern does not apply anymore. Angular 21’s Vitest builder runs tests in Node + jsdom, not a real browser.

To reproduce your two-mode setup:

1. Local debugging

Use Node’s inspector instead of Chrome:

.vscode/launch.json

{
  "type": "node",
  "request": "launch",
  "name": "Debug Vitest",
  "runtimeExecutable": "npx",
  "runtimeArgs": ["ng", "test", "--watch"],
  "autoAttachChildProcesses": true
}

Start this config → set breakpoints → debug normally.

(You can also use a “JavaScript Debug Terminal” and run ng test.)

2. Headless pipeline run

Create a CI configuration:

// angular.json
"test": {
  "configurations": {
    "ci": { "watch": false }
  }
}

Then run:

ng test --configuration ci

So Vitest = Node debugging, and CI/headless = Angular test configuration, not Chrome flags.

Q: What does the "only diagonals can be replaced" error in netmeta mean? A:

The issue was that the most recent version of netmeta on CRAN did not support the use of SMDs. Installing the most recent developer version of netmeta via remotes resolved the issue: remotes::install_github("guido-s/netmeta")

Q: Export DWG in Inventor Api with AutoCAD color indices A:

You can find the supported options by bringing up the Options dialog using ShowSaveCopyAsOptions or ShowOpenOptions for the user, setting the options you want to use, and then checking the values in the returned Options variable.

E.g. checking the DWF save options:

Sub GetDwfOptions()
  Dim app As Application
  Set app = ThisApplication
  Dim addins As ApplicationAddIns
  Set addins = app.ApplicationAddIns
  ' Get the DWF AddIn using its ID
  Dim DWFAddIn As TranslatorAddIn
  Set DWFAddIn = _
    addins.ItemById("{0AC6FD95-2F4D-42CE-8BE0-8AEA580399E4}")
  ' Activate AddIn
  DWFAddIn.Activate
  Dim SourceObject As Object
  Dim Context As TranslationContext
  Dim Options As NameValueMap
  Dim transientObj As TransientObjects
  Set transientObj = app.TransientObjects
  Set Context = transientObj.CreateTranslationContext
  Context.Type = kUnspecifiedIOMechanism
  Set Options = transientObj.CreateNameValueMap
  Set SourceObject = ThisApplication.ActiveDocument
  ' Check if the translator has 'SaveCopyAs' options
  If DWFAddIn.HasSaveCopyAsOptions( _
    SourceObject, Context, Options) Then
    ' You can also show the Options dialog
    ' and then set whatever you need, then
    ' check here how those settings are stored
    Call DWFAddIn.ShowSaveCopyAsOptions( _
      SourceObject, Context, Options)
    ' Now print out the values
    Call PrintInfo(Options, 1)
  End If
End Sub

See this for more: https://blog.autodesk.io/get-option-names-and-values-supported-by-inventor-translator-addins-via-api/

Update:
In the case of formats that support the usage of ini files, the settings you want might be stored there. So set up everythig as you want in the Options dialog then save the ini file - in the case of the DWG Export it's here:

After checking the generated ini file's comntent it looks like the ACI option is set like this:
USE ACI FOR ENTITIES AND LAYERS=Yes

Q: Does the TLS cert would require an common SAN A:

Look at Chrome requires SAN names in Certificate. When will other browsers (IE) follow?: some browsers (Chrome) require names to be in the SAN part as they disregard now completely the CN field

So even for a one domain certificate you need the domain both in the CN (as this is not optional) and in the SAN part.

It is also in the CAB Forum requirements, section 7.1.4.2.1 :

Certificate Field: extensions:subjectAltName

Required/Optional: Required

Contents: This extension MUST contain at least one entry. Each entry MUST be either a dNSName containing the Fully-Qualified Domain Name or an iPAddress containing the IP address of a server. The CA MUST confirm that the Applicant controls the Fully-Qualified Domain Name or IP address or has been granted the right to use it by the Domain Name Registrant or IP address assignee, as appropriate. Wildcard FQDNs are permitted.

Note that some other browsers, like Firefox, fallback to the CN instead, see don't fall back to subject common name for name information for new certificates and see beginning of patch at bug 1245280 - add policy mechanism to optionally enforce BRs for falling back to subject CN for the security.pki.name_matching_mode configuration option.

Q: Entity Framework SqlException: Invalid object name A:

Another possibility with this is like what I experienced. I have a custom schema and the migrations create the tables under this schema, but the DB User had a default schema of dbo still.

Q: Randomly getting "Error reading SSH protocol banner" in Paramiko A:

"Error reading SSH protocol banner" happens while connecting. It should not have anything to do with any specific file. It's rather that the server rejects the connection randomly.

Aren't you connecting too frequently? From the wording of your question, it looks like you are opening a new connection for every file. Consider reusing the connecting for all transfers.

Or the server (or your network) is simply not reliable. If that's so, you will have to code a retry mechanism.

See also Paramiko : Error reading SSH protocol banner
